src.analysis.h3_uncertainty package¶

Submodules¶

src.analysis.h3_uncertainty.glm module¶

Statsmodels GLM helpers for the H3 uncertainty bucket analysis.

src.analysis.h3_uncertainty.glm.bucket_group_accuracy(records: DataFrame, aha_col: str) → DataFrame[source]¶

Compute per-bucket accuracy for aha/non-aha groups.

src.analysis.h3_uncertainty.glm.fit_glm_bucket_interaction(data_frame: DataFrame, aha_col: str, strict_interaction_only: bool, cluster_by: str, out_txt: str) → Tuple[Dict[str, Any], Any][source]¶

Fit a GLM that captures accuracy deltas across uncertainty buckets.

src.analysis.h3_uncertainty.ingest module¶

Helpers for loading pass1/pass2 rows and computing Aha/uncertainty features.

Bases: object

Behavioral knobs for deriving aha labels on a pass row.

src.analysis.h3_uncertainty.ingest.add_perplexity_buckets(df_pass1: DataFrame, n_buckets: int, method: str, custom_edges: List[float] | None = None) → DataFrame[source]¶

Annotate df_pass1 with quantile- or edge-based uncertainty buckets.

Extract an entropy/perplexity signal from pass_dict.

src.analysis.h3_uncertainty.ingest.load_rows(files: List[str], gpt_mode: str = 'canonical', gate_gpt_by_words: bool = True, unc_field: str = 'answer', measure: str = 'entropy') → DataFrame[source]¶

Load pass1/pass2 samples needed for the uncertainty-bucket analysis.

Plotting utilities for the H3 uncertainty bucket analysis.

Plot histogram of prompt-level delta outcomes, optionally grouped by forced Aha.

src.analysis.h3_uncertainty.reasking module¶

Re-asking table construction and Wilson CI helpers.

Build paired and aggregated tables summarizing re-asking outcomes.

Per-prompt accuracy with Wilson confidence intervals.

src.analysis.h3_uncertainty.reasking.question_level_any_with_ci(m_pairs: DataFrame, group_keys: List[str]) → DataFrame[source]¶

Per-problem accuracy with Wilson confidence intervals.

Split prompt/problem summaries by Aha variant based on pass1 flags.

src.analysis.h3_uncertainty.reasking.wilson_ci(num_success: int, num_trials: int, alpha: float = 0.05) → Tuple[float, float][source]¶

Compute the Wilson binomial proportion interval for num_success/num_trials.
